wolk.models package¶

wolk.ActuatorCommand module¶

ActuatorCommand Module.

class wolk.models.ActuatorCommand.ActuatorCommand(reference, command, value=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Deserialized actuator command sent from WolkAbout IoT Platform.

Actuator command received.

Parameters:
  • reference (str) – Reference of the actuator
  • command (wolk.models.ActuatorCommandType.ActuatorCommandType) – Command to be executed
  • value (int or float or str or None) – Value to be set to

Alarm event that ocurred on device.

Information about alarm event.

Parameters:
  • reference (str) – Alarm reference
  • active (bool) – Current state of the alarm
  • timestamp (int or None) – Unix timestamp. If not provided, platform will assign

wolk.Device module¶

Device Module.

class wolk.models.Device.Device(key, password, actuator_references=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Hold all necessary information to communicate with WolkAbout IoT Platform.

Variables:
  • actuator_references (list) – Actuator references enabled on device
  • key (str) – Device key obtained when creating device on WolkAbout IoT Platform
  • logger (logging.Logger) – Logger instance issued by wolk.LoggerFactory
  • password (str) – Password obtained when creating device on WolkAbout IoT Platform

Contain device credentials necessary for connection to WolkAbout IoT Platform.

Parameters:
  • key (str) – Device key obtained when creating device on WolkAbout IoT Platform
  • password (str) – Password obtained when creating device on WolkAbout IoT Platform
  • actuator_references (list or None) – Actuator references enabled on device

wolk.FileTransferPacket module¶

FileTransferPacket Module.

class wolk.models.FileTransferPacket.FileTransferPacket(previous_hash, data, current_hash)[source]¶

Bases: object

Hold all data contained from a firmware chunk request response.

Chunk of a firmware file.

Parameters:
  • previous_hash (bytes) – Hash of the previous chunk
  • data (bytes) – Requested chunk
  • current_hash (bytes) – Hash of the current chunk

wolk.FirmwareCommand module¶

FirmwareCommand Module.

class wolk.models.FirmwareCommand.FirmwareCommand(command, file_name=None, file_size=None, file_hash=None, auto_install=None, file_url=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Firmware update command received from WolkAbout IoT Platform.

Firmware command that was received.

Parameters:
  • command (wolk.models.FirmwareCommandType.FirmwareCommandType) – Command to be executed
  • file_name (str or None) – Name of the file to be received
  • file_size (int or None) – Size of the file to be received
  • file_hash (str or None) – Hash of the file to be received
  • auto_install (bool or None) – Install the file when it is received
  • file_url (str or None) – URL where the file is located

class wolk.models.InboundMessage.InboundMessage(channel, payload)[source]¶

Bases: object

Inbound Messages that get received from the platform.

Inbound MQTT message.

Parameters:
  • channel (str) – Channel where the message was published to
  • payload (str or bytes) – Payload of the message that was published to channel

Outbound Message that gets published to the platform.

Data ready to be sent as an MQTT message.

Parameters:
  • channel (str) – Channel where the message will be published to
  • payload (str or None) – Payload of message that will be published to channel
